intro: Hazardia rosarica, commonly known as the Rosaryweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Hazardia rosarica is often found in disturbed areas and can be an invasive species in some regions.
